title: ananyabushra
author: ananyabushra
content: As you may know, many exchanges now require KYC, which can be a hassle for some people. However, I've done thorough research and found a fantastic option for those who want to trade without going through the KYC process. Bitget appears to be the optimal choice here. Moreover, joining Bitget from India can be highly profitable now; Not only can you trade without KYC, but there are also special offers exclusively for Indians. So, don't miss this opportunity and browse through the details. It's a chance worth taking!

comments.author: Nonstopspider
comments.body: Hi interesting, Can you share more details of that? I need to hold a token after that and what are the offers?

comments.author: ananyabushra
comments.body: Quote from: Nonstopspider on July 20, 2023, 05:54:59 PMHi interesting, Can you share more details of that? I need to hold a token after that and what are the offers?No need to hold any tokens. Just register and join the event. You'll receive 1 spin for depositing over $100, another spin for depositing over $500, and an additional spin for trading over $100. That's how you can get up to 14 spins from each account. There are various rewards for this event, such as $10k, $100 Starbucks gift card, 1 air-conditioner, and more.

comments.author: Vivageneviv
comments.body: You mentioned it to be the best platform without KYC, so what unique trading benefits it offers compared to other platforms?

comments.author: ananyabushra
comments.body: Quote from: Vivageneviv on July 20, 2023, 06:49:23 PMYou mentioned it to be the best platform without KYC, so what unique trading benefits it offers compared to other platforms?Not every platform offers the same leverage benefits to both KYC and NON KYC users, but Bitget does. I believe that small details like this altogether make it a reliable one.

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: I have seen a similar event earlier as well. Are these events even real?. I would love it if you can let me know more.

comments.author: ananyabushra

So, don't miss this opportunity and browse through the details. It's a chance worth taking!Cryptocurrency is gaining adoption at a very fast rate. I am glad we got exchanges doing something special for users. Such giveaways are a motivation to continue trading and investing in the industry.The giveaways work like a motivational charm, especially for newcomers who feel encouraged by receiving rewards.

comments.author: avikz

So, don't miss this opportunity and browse through the details. It's a chance worth taking!Can you share any link of the offers they are running for Indian people. I have search but couldn't find anything. It will be great if you can share a link. Also Bitget is an old exchange (not that much popular though). Also I see that their partnership with Lionel Messi is actually authentic. https://messi.com/en/bitget-partners-with-leo-messi/But if really there's no KYC requirement, I would want to try that.

comments.author: ananyabushra
comments.body: Quote from: avikz on July 25, 2023, 05:58:21 PMQuote from: ananyabushra on July 20, 2023, 05:20:11 PMAs you may know, many exchanges now require KYC, which can be a hassle for some people. Also I see that their partnership with Lionel Messi is actually authentic. https://messi.com/en/bitget-partners-with-leo-messi/But if really there's no KYC requirement, I would want to try that. I'm not entirely sure whether you can take part in region-exclusive events without completing KYC, but you are allowed to trade unlimitedly without any KYC. If you still wanna check it out, you may browse through > https://www.bitget.com/dynamicActivities?uuid=a89e0ce28f0952e684e498ad8703ee1c

comments.author: Bitcoin Smith
comments.body: Quote from: avikz on July 25, 2023, 05:58:21 PMBut if really there's no KYC requirement, I would want to try that. AFAIK, Bitget platform has mandatory KYC for every users and surprisingly it is highly invasive than we do on most of the centralized exchanges. So better not deposit any funds their unless you want to provide these details.Quote from: https://www.bitget.com/support/articles/360041116691-Bitget’s-AML-KYC-PoliciesIdentifying our CustomersWe shall identify each of our customers.To identify our customers, we shall obtain, at least:1. their full names, including aliases;2. their unique identification numbers (such as an identity card number, birth certificate number, or passport number, or where the customer is not a natural person, their business registration numbers); or3. their registration address, or if applicable, their registered business address, and if different, their principal place of business;

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin Smith on July 26, 2023, 08:49:28 AMAFAIK, Bitget platform has mandatory KYC for every users and surprisingly it is highly invasive than we do on most of the centralized exchanges. So better not deposit any funds their unless you want to provide these details.Quote from: https://www.bitget.com/support/articles/360041116691-Bitget’s-AML-KYC-PoliciesIdentifying our CustomersWe shall identify each of our customers.To identify our customers, we shall obtain, at least:1. their full names, including aliases;2. their unique identification numbers (such as an identity card number, birth certificate number, or passport number, or where the customer is not a natural person, their business registration numbers); or3. their registration address, or if applicable, their registered business address, and if different, their principal place of business;You are absolutely correct the OP replied on my thread and is unable to provide any links that substantiate her claims. Amazingly when I questioned here she supported here claims with a screenshot. She claims that it was from the customer support of the exchange. Whereas if you go through their blog there is nothing related to non-KYC trading. Another spammer, spamming the local board without any concrete evidence.

comments.author: ananyabushra
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on July 26, 2023, 11:58:43 AMQuote from: Bitcoin Smith on July 26, 2023, 08:49:28 AMAFAIK, Bitget platform has mandatory KYC for every users and surprisingly it is highly invasive than we do on most of the centralized exchanges. Amazingly when I questioned here she supported here claims with a screenshot. She claims that it was from the customer support of the exchange. Whereas if you go through their blog there is nothing related to non-KYC trading. Another spammer, spamming the local board without any concrete evidence.  To be honest, you're the one who's spamming. You asked for proof, and I shared what I knew. The screenshot showed a clear statement from Bitget, just as you had asked. I also shared an article on the withdrawal limits. What else do you want me to do? I have never even shared ANY kind of referral links so I don't even have any profit here

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: Quote from: ananyabushra on July 26, 2023, 12:13:20 PMTo be honest, you're the one who's spamming. You asked for proof, and I shared what I knew. The screenshot showed a clear statement from Bitget, just as you had asked. I also shared an article on the withdrawal limits. What else do you want me to do? I have never even shared ANY kind of referral links so I don't even have any profit hereYeah, you are right I am spamming! You need to understand that there are multiple tools available to prove my claim of you spamming my thread. Another reason for me accusing you of spamming is that you do not have any evidence that the exchange is providing NON-KYC trading. We do not take screenshots as an answer as in the past there have been many who did the same. As a result innocent members lost their investment. If you can show me written documentation by the exchange then I would clearly accept it. Otherwise do not spam! Do not act like an innocent newbie.

comments.author: Bitcoin Smith
comments.body: Quote from: ananyabushra on July 26, 2023, 12:13:20 PMTo be honest, you're the one who's spamming. You asked for proof, and I shared what I knew. The screenshot showed a clear statement from Bitget, just as you had asked. I also shared an article on the withdrawal limits. What else do you want me to do? I have never even shared ANY kind of referral links so I don't even have any profit hereYou can't take a stand based on what you know, it has to be what is the fact and I shared you about their KYC policies which clearly mentioned that they request KYC for every individual and there is no trace of non verified users or about their withdrawal limits which means either you are wrong or the one who gave you the answer from support is wrong.If you still want to prove that you are right, then go ahead and create an account on your own in the platform you are vouching for and give us a proof.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Actually what OP is saying is correct. Unfortunately she is unable to submit a proof to justify her claim. I was able to find out the post from the exchange by visiting their telegram channel. According to the post which was published on January this year non KYC user can make $50 withdrawal daily. In case if anyone want to check the article then please click on this link : https://www.bitget.com/support/articles/360053002431Thanks.
